pages.text: Schematics can be used to duplicate builds easily.$(br2)$(italics)If you need to conceptualize something in a Creative Test World and then reconstruct it in Survival, Schematics can do just that!
To save a schematic, use the Schematic and Quill.$(br2)$(italics)Using this will save it to a file in in your installation, under the schematics directory$().
After saving a schematic, you will need to write to an Empty Schematic using the Schematic Table. Use a written-to schematic in the world to designate a location and rotation for it.

And finally, after assigning a location to a written-to schematic, it can be placed in a Schematicannon to "print" it.$(br2)Place a container next to it with the required blocks, and place Gunpowder in the cannon.
$(italics)Some blocks will not function correctly when used with schematics or the schematicannon. Don't bother trying to print assembled multiblocks, they will be invisible and nonfunctional.
